data.title: Nobel Prize Convergences
data.meta_description: One indication of the prestige of the Neustadt International Prize for Literature is its record of 34 laureates, finalists, or jurors who in the past 51 years have been awarded Nobel Prizes following their involvement with the Neustadt Prize, with only one exception: José Saramago (Portugal), who was a Nobel Prize recipient before being considered […]
data.text: One indication of the prestige of the Neustadt International Prize for Literature is its record of 34 laureates, finalists, or jurors who in the past 51 years have been awarded Nobel Prizes following their involvement with the Neustadt Prize, with only one exception: José Saramago (Portugal), who was a Nobel Prize recipient before being considered for the Neustadt.
